verses.roman:
sattvaṁ cāsya vinirbhinnaṁ
mahān dhiṣṇyam upāviśat
cittenāṁśena yenāsau
vijñānaṁ pratipadyate

synonyms: sattvam—consciousness; ca—also; asya—of the gigantic form; vinirbhinnam—being separately manifested; mahān—the total energy, mahat-tattva; dhiṣṇyam—with control; upāviśat—entered into; cittena aṁśena—along with His part of consciousness; yena—by which; asau—the living entity; vijñānam—specific knowledge; pratipadyate—cultivates.
translation: Thereafter, when His consciousness separately manifested itself, the total energy, mahat-tattva, entered with His conscious part. Thus the living entity is able to conceive specific knowledge.
